result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole A Escobedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/DNA to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 5/15/2016 or penalty of 7 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole A Escobedo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole A Escobedo in court with attorney Williams Buttery.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Restitution has been paid.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

FINE: $505.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Fine/DNA to be paid at a rate of $50.00 commencing 5/15/2016.  Failure to pay will result in 7 days huber.
Sentencing hearing on April 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on April 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicole A Escobedo in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for Tedia K. Gamino.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Attorney Buttery Williams request the Court schedule a seperate sentencing date.  The Court grants the request and sets the matter accordingly.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for Tedia K. Gamino in court.   Defendant Nicole A Escobedo did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for   Attorney appears by authorizationTedia K. Gamino in court.   Defendant Nicole A Escobedo did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Next hearing is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with JCPenny store/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Nicole A Escobedo in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
